website_summaries.verdict: The Dymo LabelWriter 450 Duo combines two printers in one case, with both a printer for paper labels and one for plastic labels.
pros: Comes with excellent label-printing program plus driver and add-ins for Word and Excel
Prints on both paper and plastic labels
cons: Word add-in doesn't integrate smoothly with Word

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality barcodes  :-( Unscannable
customer_reviews.text: The D1 tape (not the labels but the tape that you can insert in this machine) print quality is great with regular text. BUT... it's terrible with barcodes!! See attached picture. Dreadful. I used the supplied ‘starter’ roll of 1 inch D1 tape. It’s unusable - the barcodes won't scan. I can't find any examples online of what the D1 tape barcodes are supposed to look like, so I'm not sure if this is just a faulty unit or not. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Cork

customer_reviews.title: Dymo printer I recommend them
customer_reviews.text: I love my Dymo label writer 450 duo thermal printer. This is my second one. I messed up the bottom part cutter after it jammed after 12 plus years of use. I think that is pretty good amount of time / use even though I damaged it. I might have been able to fix with out damaging it I am not sure. I have not used this new one a lot yet, but I am sure with the brand name I will again get many years use out of it. I highly recommend this to those of us that like to label things, have businesses etc (are OCD) LOL Thanks all. :)
customer_reviews.author: Harry Potter

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, software could be a little more flexible... but I'm trying to do things that are a little outside of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to use software is thoughtfully setup to make most common tasks smooth. Some could be improved... but you can probably find a way to do about anything by printing from MS Word, Excel, or some other program with some experimentation. The tap writer portion should allow more flexibility for what is entered to be printed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Product Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: No battery needed!
customer_reviews.text: Soooo tired of the other label writers that require a charged battery to operate. The battery fails to hold a charge after a year and costs as much as a writer to replace. This unit does both types of labels, no battery needed. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Pro

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect it to work properly.
customer_reviews.text: The printer is supposed to do two things: print larger shipping labels and smaller tape labels (for file folders, etc.). The shipping label part works just fine but the smaller tape label doesn't work at all. We were told that we should buy different tape cartridges and we did just that - to no avail, which pushed us a few days beyond the return date on Amazon. We purchased a DUO - meaning two-function - and got a MONO, meaning one-function. This is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Plave

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: This little label printer works better than I expected. It's fast - first label comes out less than 2 seconds. It doesn't use a standard print driver (which makes sense). The DYNO software took a few seconds to figure out, but no manual was needed - just a little playing. 5 minutes later - it was surprisingly productive. Every small office should have one - a 1000 times better than trying to print a few labels on a sheet & trying to line them up correctly.
customer_reviews.author: JC45458

customer_reviews.title: Fast Printing
customer_reviews.text: I have used Dymo labelers in the past as well as Brother P-touch models. The Dymo 450 Duo is the fastest and most versatile of them all. I haven't tried the postage feature but for mailing labels and for file folders it works great. It's small footprint also works well in my crowded office. The software is intuitive and easy to use. The graphics on screen verify the final output.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Dallas

customer_reviews.title: I would definately recommend this as it has both the options which include color labels (both sizes)
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from the label manager and so far I have been very impressed, it is of course much larger but I have found somewhere on my desk where it fits fine. I do like the software that comes with it too as it makes printing labels so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Hoverrat

customer_reviews.title: I love this unit
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. Works perfectly on my mac and PC ... I can only get the paper label to work on the Dymo Print-Server, though. I ordered the Brother PT-P750W so that we could network-ly print the plastic labels.
customer_reviews.author: David Kish

customer_reviews.title: Use in a Production Enviroment
customer_reviews.text: We have lots of these printers throughout the production floor, and all work well. For database automation, the only issue I have is that the SDK Library in C# doesn't suppport the tape function. I believe Dymo just released an update to their software, but haven't had a chance to review the update. The tape function works great in their software.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: I have turned simple databases to full point of sales ...
customer_reviews.text: I have turned simple databases to full point of sales systems using these printers. From permits to bar code price tags, you can do it all with Dymo.
customer_reviews.author: john steele

customer_reviews.title: The concept as such is great. We have one from the US and one ...
customer_reviews.text: we had some issues with the tape printer (and we buy the original cartridges). The concept as such is great. We have one from the US and one from Europe and they use different supplies. It took as a while to figure that out.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M

customer_reviews.title: Too many parts missing
customer_reviews.text: Product not usable had too many parts missing, no instructions, no software no power cord, and other unknown parts missing. As of 1 January 2014 I have not received credit for returning this item nor any other information. As of 8 January 2014 I have not received credit for returning this item nor any other information. I am beginning to assume that the whole transaction is a scam. I will contact VISA and file a complaint since Amazon does not respond and does not list any way to contact them. Update Amazon claims they are waiting for the return to arrive. UPS has indicated and issued proof that it was delivered and signed for it on 12/11/2013 at 10:00 AM.
customer_reviews.author: BART

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and easy for creating nice mailing labels and for ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic and easy for creating nice mailing labels and for labeling folders, gadgets, etc to get better organized. Im a big fan of DYMO and also use their 4XL for larger shipments.
customer_reviews.author: The Lani

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected the label maker won't work tried contact ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as expected the label maker won't work tried contact tech support , they can't do anything about it so you buy as it is !!!
customer_reviews.author: Meshal Dashti

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out after 1yr
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for 1yrs and it's already not printing my barcodes well. I've bought the name brand tape to go through it but it still just wont work well.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Efficient to use
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the way the product works, make sure you by the branded tape to go with it, generic options don't give the desired look and often get clogged in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Must HAVE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Labeler so much I bought another one.. must have if u have things to label. so easy to use I label everything now... Great Great Product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little worker bee.
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously fast printing. Super easy software. 3rd party labels and cartridges work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Nancoo

customer_reviews.title: Great, Easy to use and makes life easier.
customer_reviews.text: Works Great! And I love the two different label sizes. I have the Demo 4xl for my shipping labels and use this for other type of labels for my products testers, ingredient containers, and soon my bar codes.
customer_reviews.author: Clair P

customer_reviews.title: Continually jams
customer_reviews.text: Continually jams and first one fully broke with in the first year. Required for the company otherwise wouldn’t have bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Bruneau

customer_reviews.title: Dream come true.
customer_reviews.text: I label everything as an IT guy. This has been a dream come true. Install and setup was fast and easy, we use them onsite as well as I have one here at home. Dymo makes a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amaizing Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Dymo label printers
customer_reviews.text: I love Dymo label printers, but this one does not measure up. The tape printer doesn't work well. It jams up.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto diSpriggs

customer_reviews.title: Good design, software sucks, laminate labels limited
customer_reviews.text: Dymo printers are great, but - This printer is expensive. $180??? Seriously?? - Unable to get software working on a Windows 7 (x64). Tech support was useless. - Labels. The thermal labels are reasonable, but their laminate labels selection is not that great. - The well where the laminate label goes can be tricky and if you put it in wrong, it will ruin the label I was looking a the Brother Label printer QL710W (no laminate, just straight label) and it looks pretty sweet. No only is it $106, but it's faster and has built in wireless capability..
customer_reviews.author: Eric T.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Took a little configuration on my Mac to get the label writer to print out only one label. Once configured, it works great and saves me time on my shipping and address labels.
customer_reviews.author: J Sp3ctRe

customer_reviews.title: Good printer if it works
customer_reviews.text: Nice printer while it worked. Bottom printer stopped working after a year.
customer_reviews.author: O.B.

customer_reviews.title: Loved our 1st LabelWriter Duo so much
customer_reviews.text: Loved our 1st LabelWriter Duo so much, got tired of sharing it, so got one for myself! This printer really takes care of SO many needs. Very handy, reliable, free software is quick/easy to install and makes it easy to make very professional labels. I use it for making barcode labels, address labels, logo labels - you name it. If you don't have one of these, you're missing out.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuyInHouston

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up and works as expected. Best feature: prints two types of labels Work feature: the stock software that comes it is not very user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Pietro Immordino

customer_reviews.title: Love this Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Prints barcode labels in different formats, widths, tape or label, amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: software could be more user friendly
customer_reviews.text: works good, but the label software could be a bit more user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Breno A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, we have few of them on our office, super fast and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: LJV-FL

customer_reviews.title: easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: I make labels for everything now, easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: 50% of it works
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hoping the reviews on the tape label printer wouldn't be true in my case. I was wrong. IF I can get it to print a laminated label, it will jam afterwards and cut little slivers of the tape of repeatedly. Then the knife jammed open and I couldn't even get a cartridge back inside to get the blinking light to stop. Finally got the cartridge back in, but it won't feed anything. So disappointed. Label printer works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dexs Books

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Love IT!!! have no idea what I ever did with out it. I can change the clip art on the parcel labels from work to silly pictures for the Grand kids.
customer_reviews.author: Dodger

customer_reviews.title: mGreat label maker
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker. I have one in each of my branch offices. The software is very easy to use. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: mhuis

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery and it works perfect.Thanks for the great value.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a label printer that could print small polyester permanent black/silver labels and found this one could do it. There was this used one for less than half the price so I took a chance. It works great and the labels look very professional.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Bruno

customer_reviews.title: It's small, which is good.
customer_reviews.text: It installed flawlessly, print quality is good. The software is akin to MS publisher. I like that it is specilized and the output is linear. A lot less wasted labels. And they don't washout when wet (with water anyway) they don't hold up to solvents of course. I use it for my hobbies, cooking, labeling cables... Very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Hoodycrow

customer_reviews.title: Nice little printer that prints paper labels and tape labels
customer_reviews.text: Nice little printer that prints paper labels and tape labels. The software is quite glitchy and I contacted the manufacturer and reinstalled according to their directions and still have problems.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Cwik

customer_reviews.title: DYMO Labelwriter 450 series
customer_reviews.text: Now, I have three of these, 450 Twin, 450 Duo, 450 4XL. I use this one the 450 Duo to print plastic labels & multi-purpose labels. Then I use the 450 Twin Turbo to print postage stamps & address labels. And I use the 450 4XL to print shipping labels. You will need to have a DYMO stamp account for stamps, and a Endicia account for shipping labels.
customer_reviews.author: LJC0867

customer_reviews.title: I got a recycled unit
customer_reviews.text: The unit was OK but I think it had been a recycled product. It came in the manufacturers box but the printer was in bubble wrap that didn't appear to what the manufacturer would do. In addition, the D1 roll was not in the normal packaging and seemed to have been used. It was torn but I was able to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Willy C

customer_reviews.title: Best label writer thus far
customer_reviews.text: One of the best label writers on the market. Never had any problems with it jamming like I have with another brand. Very pleased with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stillwater County

customer_reviews.title: jury still out
customer_reviews.text: ordered first unit and after intall gave an error, "label path blocked" when attempted print folder labels, this was no an accurate description. it turns out you have to select print labels, then the label printer seems to work okay. however two weeks later the label printer is still glitchy. we will see what happens next???
customer_reviews.author: Brent Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Multifunctional
customer_reviews.text: Nice multifunctional printer for variety of labels. The software is convenient as well. We will use it for postage and product labeling.
customer_reviews.author: Evaldas Pabreza

customer_reviews.title: This one is great and much faster than my old one
customer_reviews.text: My first one went belly up...had to get a replacement. This one is great and much faster than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Rich A Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to set up. Cartridges can get expensive, but it's nice to be able to print out professional looking labels.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific label printer. Or I should say this is a "great" label printer. Never had one before. I must say that I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: PCJ

customer_reviews.title: DYMO/Endicia/Newell Rubbermaid RIP OFF!!!
customer_reviews.text: Please... save yourself some aggravation and DO NOT purchase this printer. It will print labels but if you are wanting to print stamps with it, you will be immediately trapped into having to upgrade the printer. This is a rip-off. If you believe the description that you are able to print DYMO stamps, you will not be able to. You will either have to pay a monthly subscription fee or pay for another upgrade and who knows what else. Endicia support line is very sarcastic and rude. Please do not deal with DYMO/Endicia/Newell Rubbermaid. You will be very sorry that you purchased from them.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Coker

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: This was great once we called support to get it hooked up to our Mac. Support was really helpful and now everything works great!
customer_reviews.author: pthorp

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE LABEL MAKER
customer_reviews.text: I think Amazon received a bad batch of these. I just received my second one which has the same problem. Put the tape in and it feeds out a little and won't cut. Now the tape is stuck and you can't cycle the cutter or anything to get the tape cassette out. The factory is going to send me another one. We have a 400 Dymo Lable/Tape writer Duo and we like it very much. Hopefully the 3rd 450Duo will work for us. ??? I'll follow this up when I receive it. I JUST RECEIVED MY REPLACEMENT PRODUCT FROM DYMO AND IT WORKS GREAT. AS I SAID I THINK AMAZON HAS A BAD BATCH OF THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Gravey

product_meta.title: DYMO 1752267 LabelWriter 450 Duo Thermal Label Printer
product_meta.description: Size:450 Duo Machine| Style:450 Duo Machine| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingCreate and print up to 71 address, shipping, file folder and barcode labels, name badges and more per minute. Use included DYMO Stamps software to print USPS-approved postage directly from your desktop - without fees, contracts or monthly commitments. Prints on paper or easy-peel, split-back D1 tape (1/4-, 3/8-, or 1/2-inch sizes). Thermal printing creates labels with no ink or toner. Connect to PC or Mac, and you're ready to print labels right from Word, Excel, Outlook, QuickBooks and other programs.
feature_bullets: Create and print up to 71 address, shipping, file folder and barcode labels, name badges and more per minute.
Use included DYMO Stamps software to print USPS approved postage directly from your desktop without fees, contracts or monthly commitments.
Thermal printing technology eliminates the need for expensive ink or toner
Connect to PC or Mac, and you're ready to print labels right from Word, Excel, Outlook, Quick Books and other programs
Please refer the User Guide before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars86 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
